issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5.Description:
1. Launch KS.
2. Go to BaseUI -> Views ->image views -->image scaling.

h5.Actual Result:
1. Appc logo is stretched & no dimensions are not retrieved. Its stuck at retrieving dimensions.

h5.Expected Result:
1. The appc logo shhould not be stretched & we should get the dimensions.
fields.summary: BlackBerry: KitchenSink: BaseUI > Views > image views > image scaling; appc logo id stretched & no dimensions are retirved.
fields.environment:
Environment:
Appc Studio : 3.2.3.201403250634
Ti SDK : 3.2.2.GA
Mac OSX : 10.8.5
Alloy : 1.3.1	
CLI - 3.2.3-dev
BB Z10 - 10.2.1.2.2156
Kitchensink from studio (3.2.2)

comments.body: The problem here is the blob object. It needs to be revisited, estimating 3 days.

Mac OSX 10.9.2
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201405121247
Titanium SDK, build: 3.3.0.v20140515133312
Titanium CLI, build: 3.3.0-dev
Alloy: 1.4.0-alpha
BlackBerry SDK: 10.3
BlackBerry Simulator: 10.3.0.440

Image is not stretched and the dimensions are correctly obtained and displayed.
Closing.
